title: Voting guide: Here’s what voters need to know before Boston’s Tuesday election
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Boston polls open from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. across 275 precincts on election day.
Mayor Wu runs unopposed while Boston City Council races, including four at-large seats, are contested.
Mailed ballots can be returned to drop boxes or City Hall by 8 p.m.; 32,737 mailed ballots returned so far.

title: The Bruins’ second line is looking like a difference-maker, in more ways than one
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Casey Mittelstadt, Pavel Zacha, and Viktor Arvidsson are leading the Bruins' second line, contributing significantly to recent victories.
Coach Marco Sturm's tactic of benching players like Mittelstadt has sparked improved performance and contributed to team success.
Trade considerations loom as Bruins' strong second line effort could influence asset strategies before the NHL trade deadline.

title: Garrett Crochet, Roman Anthony named finalist for Cy Young, Rookie of the Year Awards
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox's Garrett Crochet named a finalist for AL Cy Young Award after leading the league with 205.1 innings and 255 strikeouts.
Crochet competes against Tarik Skubal and Hunter Brown for the Cy Young, with Skubal leading in ERA and WHIP.
Roman Anthony, playing 71 games, is a finalist for AL Rookie of the Year with a .292 average, 8 HRs, 32 RBIs.

title: Ranking top priorities for Patriots at NFL trade deadline
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots identify edge rusher as top priority ahead of the NFL trade deadline, seeking to enhance their pass-rushing unit.
New England also targets running backs to strengthen their ground game, with names like Jerome Ford as potential additions.
Receiver depth and secondary reinforcements are additional considerations for the Patriots as they evaluate trade options.

title: Patriots’ pass-protection issues are mounting as Drake Maye ties worrisome stat from last year
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots allowed 34 sacks this season, second-most in the NFL, with 12 in the last two games.
Drake Maye tied last season's sack total in fewer games while New England averages 26.3 points per game.
Rookies on the left and new starters contribute to line issues; Campbell and Wilson top sack allowance ranks.

title: Downtown Boston hotel settles discrimination complaint after woman was accused of being a man
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Liberty Hotel settles with MCAD after woman alleged wrongful ejection from Kentucky Derby party in May.
Settlement includes $10,000 donation and mandatory hotel staff anti-discrimination training and policy updates.
Woman plans civil lawsuit seeking damages, claiming hotel statements were false and executives covered up misconduct.

title: Falcons coach walks back ‘clapgate’ accusations after Patriots push back
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Falcons coach Raheem Morris initially accused the Patriots of simulating snap counts, causing an early snap in Sunday's game.
Morris later retracted the accusation, attributing the early snap to communication issues within his team rather than the Patriots.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel downplayed the controversy, stating he didn't observe any clapping mimicking during the game.

title: Alex Bregman opts out of Red Sox contract, will hit free agency
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Alex Bregman opted out of his Red Sox contract and will enter free agency with two years left on the deal.
Bregman, 32, had a .273/.360/.462 slash line with 18 home runs and 62 RBIs in 114 games for Boston in 2025.
The Red Sox may pursue Bregman, but teams like the Tigers and Mariners are expected to be interested in signing him.

title: Patriots NFL trade deadline live updates: Will New England make moves before Tuesday?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots evaluating potential upgrades before NFL trade deadline, considering both immediate and long-term benefits.
New England possible trade targets include Dolphins' Jaylen Waddle and Saints' Alvin Kamara.
Patriots in buying mode but might trade Anfernee Jennings, who hasn't started this season.

title: After an eventful week, Bruins’ Hampus Lindholm has ‘a lot to be thankful for’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Hampus Lindholm and fiancée Amanda welcomed their first child, Magnolia, while he returned from a lower-body injury.
The Bruins improved to 5-1-0 with Lindholm, conceding 2.3 goals per game compared to 4.25 during his absence.
Coach Marco Sturm praised Lindholm's calming effect on the team, contributing to a stronger defensive performance.
